value.title: #D32 Import PDF files in Power BI automatically from your local folder
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import PDF files in Power BI in bulk from your local folder.  To download the file, go to Curbal's download center and the communty downloads and get gile #32: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Dataflows and power query - November 2020 update

value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #106: Power Query or DAX?
value.excerpt: If you already know, how about you share your thoughts here? If not, then I will share my thoughts in the topic.  There are no perfect answers, only good questions ;)  Happy Friday!  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays survey: http://bit.ly/2MMM4KK

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #124: Weekly time intelligence in Power BI

Believe it or not, creating weekly calculations is easier than you think, and I show you how in this edition of #DAXfridays.   #DAX #Powerbi #curbal    Are you in a hurry? Skip the talk and go right to it:  01:06 Calculate Weekly

value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX! value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column.
